title.narrative: Mazabuka Sustainable Landscapes Management Project

description.narrative: In the Mazabuka District in Zambia, we have convened a diverse group of stakeholders including CSOs, government representatives, farmer association members, traditional leadership and the private sector in a platform, with the aim to identify and formulate recommendations for formal regulations and frameworks for sustainable landscape management. The project developed a series of activities in different productive sectors in partnership with producers associations, governmental institutions and local NGOs. With support, fishermen’s associations strengthened their organizations, and they included women in leadership positions and youth in patrolling activities. Their participation has led to a broader look at actions needed to find complementary income. In partnership with the Water Resource Management Authority (WARMA), Solidaridad conducted a catchment assessment to understand water extraction and distribution in the Kaleya catchment. The MSP served to discuss water pollution, sand mining and river restoration and gave rise to fruitful interventions to reduce overfishing, overgrazing, overuse of water and extractive activities. Women were supported to take the lead in village banking. Pilots worked well, fish ponds and organic horticulture and fruit production showed their potential, but water shortages and market demand for consistent quality and volumes are still hurdles to overcome. Unfortunately, the Water Authority closed its local office in 2020. The high staff turnover at several governmental institutions and Covid-19 adversely affected the well-functioning of the MSP. Overall the MSP is well received but remains financially dependent on external aid. For 2021, support from WWF Zambia will facilitate the continuation of the MSP while support from UNDP will allow for the continuation of activities of the beehives, goat-rearing and better stoves-project.

title.narrative: Governments become stakeholder in sustainable landscapes
# + kind of local landscape level gvmt policy makers committing to adopt/adjust

description.narrative: District Agriculture Coordinator, Department of Wildlife, Municipal Council commit time and resource to improve landscape policy frameworks and promote investments.

comment.narrative: District Agriculture Coordinator, Department of Wildlife, Municipal Council commit time and resource to improve landscape policy frameworks and promote investments.

Here we measure the number of government stakeholders committing to improving landscape management in Mazabuka, through their participation in the MSP Steering Committee, and providing time and capacity for the MSP agenda. These government stakeholders include representatives of the following: Mazabuka Municipal Council Ministry of Health Ministry of Agriculture Ministry of Fisheries and Livestock (MFL) Ministry of Lands and Natural Resources-Forestry Department Ministry of Education

title.narrative: RTs & VSS generate normative frameworks and funding mechanisms
Description of the sustainability issues and/or land issues on the agenda

description.narrative: Multi-stakeholder agreed landscape agenda for improvement of issues and options in landscape

comment.narrative: Multi-stakeholder agreed landscape agenda for improvement of issues and options in landscape

Conducted a gender audit in Mazabuka facilitated by partner Caritas - Monze. This was to understand the extent to which women participate in issues natural resources management. The audit found that almost every use and benefit from the natural resources cuts across men, women and children.. However, when it comes to the management of the critical available natural resources at community level, such as water and land, men as traditionally installed heads of households seems to hold more responsibilities and benefit more from these resources. One example of this is the fishing industry which is dominated by men. Follow-up up planned as result of the audit: 1. The Platform partners need to develop an approach and activities that will promote full participation of women and men in the management of natural resources especially at community level. 2. Development of a gender sensitive advocacy plan that will be implemented in partnership with the Government and other stakeholders operating in Mazabuka district to advocate for establishment of community structures that will facilitate the management of communal natural resources and ownership in line with existing Government laws.
Water User Associations are being established by WARMA, with support from Solidaridad as a way to ensure the local stakeholders have opportunity for input on management of local natural resources.

description.narrative: # SLM Policy and practice changes initiated; Integrated management of retention of crop residues; improved livestock carrying capacity;

comment.narrative: # SLM Policy and practice changes initiated; Integrated management of retention of crop residues; improved livestock carrying capacity;

"Livestock (PfC funded) Location: Itebe The project?s Main aim is to have an enhanced climate resilience of grazing and farming areas through sustainable livestock and land management systems.The Pilot has established a rotational grazing system which has been adopted by the community through the Traditional Authority, the No burning polocy which the community exercises during the 2019 period has helped the rangeland to regenerate and more grass has grown during the rain season of 2019-2020 Aquaculture Pilot, Location: Nachipoma The main objective of the assignment is to reduce over dependence of wild fish capture and introduce alternatives (such as fish ponds) that reduce the depletion rate of fish in the Kafue River, the pilot has established four pond for a fish cooperative and about 5000 fingerlings of Cat fish have been stocked and now ready for market Fruit and Vegetable Pilot, Locations: Kaleya, Hanjaalika, Lubombo and Magoye To promote Sustainable Organic Agriculture of fruit and vegetables as a way of regeneration the most degraded lands. at the start of the project only 32 farmers were trained but now we have 56 organic Farmers producing organc Fruit and Vegetables, the project has aslo linked the farmers to sustainable market for their produce Kaleya water governance Pilot, Location: Kaleya Catchment The objective of the project is to the estimate the water uses and abstraction/demand by the agricultural activities in the Kaleya. This project was completed in the second Quarter of 2019 the results lead to the development of theportal which is accesseble by all water users in the catchment, it is from this some pilot that the project has received funding ttoo implement a Resiliant water project in the other river catchment Natural Resource Management Model Pilot, Locations: Mwanachingwala; Munenga; Itebe To promote Community participation in the management of Natural Resources. Three Community Natural resource committees have been established (in Mwanachingwala, Munenga and Itebe), and river bank restoration exercise are to be carried out. Community sensitization have been done in all these areas and now the villages have planted 1500 trees in each of the three villages"

title.narrative: # + kind of stakeholders with capacities to develop and implement new SLM models

description.narrative: new models is defined here as the pilot landscape initiatives planned by the MSP

comment.narrative: new models is defined here as the pilot landscape initiatives planned by the MSP

During 2017, the MPS established two working groups tasked with developing pilot landscape solutions on both livestock and aquaculture. The pilots were designed in 2017, and therefore we measure here stakeholders with capacities to develop (not yet implement) new models. In preparing for roll out and implementation in 2018, Solidaridad supported the technical working group on livestock's involvement in the formation of the Zambian chapter of the Global Roundtable Sustainable Beef (GRSB).
The 11 stakeholders in the fisheries working group were supported to develop a monitoring framework for the aquaculture pilot - roll out is planned for 2018

title.narrative: # and names of organisations with sufficient expertise in SLM tools/solutions

comment.narrative: Pilots have been designed and developed in 2017. Implementation is therefore planned to commence in 2018. Initially REC SAF planned to count the number of participants in the technical working group(s) who were by default supporting the implementation of the pilots, however in 2018 a select number of partners (3-5) will be identified to participate in CSO capacity building (through a CSO self-assessment and action plan for improvement). While not playing a major role in the technical working groups, these CSO and partners will be called on to provide support to the technical working groups

title.narrative: # + kind of stakeholders with capacities to develop and implement new SLM models

comment.narrative: These 39 members are counted as the members fo the various TWGs who are responsible for (and supported to lead) the coordination and implementation of the landscape pilots: F&V 6, Natural Resources 12, Livestock 10 Fisheries 11

title.narrative: Qualitative and narrative reporting on progress per pilot

comment.narrative:
Livestock (PfC funded) Location: Itebe The project's Main aim is to have an enhanced climate resilience of grazing and farming areas through sustainable livestock and land management systems. The pilot will be looking at a number of interventions such as rangeland monitoring using satellite images to help curb overgrazing, and introducing a holistic farm management model with support of Grassrooots Trust.
Aquaculture Pilot, Location: Nachipoma The main objective of the assignment is to contribute to functioning of the aquacultures value chain in Mazabuka from production to the markets as a pilot innovation responding to Sustainable landscape management programme Overall we aim to reduce over dependence of wild fish capture and introduce alternatives (such as fish ponds) that reduce the depletion rate of fish in the Kafue River
Fruit and Vegetable Pilot, Locations: Kaleya, Hanjaalika, Lubombo and Magoye To promote Sustainable Organic Agriculture of fruit and vegetables as a way of regeneration the most degraded lands The project works with 32 lead farmers grouped in four clusters
Kaleya water governance Pilot, Location: Kaleya Catchment The objective of the project is to the estimate the water uses and abstraction/demand by the agricultural activities in the Kaleya. The project also aims to promote water conflict resolution by supporting WARMA develop a water allocation plan for the catchment
Natural Resource Management Model Pilot, Locations: Mwanachingwala; Munenga; Itebe To promote Community participation in the management of Natural Resources. Three Community Natural resource committees have been established (in Mwanachingwala, Munenga and Itebe), and river bank restoration exercise are to be carried out. Community sensitization have been done in all these areas. Tradition leadership engagement have been done
